result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmie L Stanley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmie L Stanley appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Jimmie L Stanley.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery (but is unable to open) and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. 
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court orders absolute sobriety, no use or possession of any dangerous weapons or firearms, no driving without a valid drivers license

Defendant Jimmie L Stanley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20,right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. The case is scheduled for a Pretrial Conference in Br 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 11/21/22 @ 1p
